relation: configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
router bgp autonomous-system-number Example: Router(config)# router bgp 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} remote-as as-number Example: Router(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 remote-as 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} update-source interface-type interface-number Example: Router(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 update-source Loopback 0
address-family ipv4 [mdt | multicast | tunnel | unicast [vrf vrf-name] | vrf vrf-name Example: Router(config-router)# address-family ipv4
neighbor {ip-address | peer-group-name | ipv6-address} activate Example: Router(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 activate
neighbor ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} send-label Example: Router(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 send-label
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Adds an entry to the multiprotocol BGP neighbor table for peering with the ASBR1.
Enables the BGP session to use a source address on the specified interface.
Enters address family configuration mode to configure a routing session using standard IPv4 address prefixes.
Enables the exchange of information for this address family with the specified BGP neighbor.
Enables label exchange for this address family to this neighbor in order to receive the remote PE IPv4 loopback with the label set to an end-to-end LSP.
pageTitle: IPv6 Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS Release 12.4T - Implementing IPv6 VPN over MPLS [Cisco IOS Software Releases 12.4 T] - Cisco
